about_the_game:
"Who the fuck ate Grandma ?" is inspired by the classic 90s point & click adventure games,
Your mission is to find out who "the fuck" ate your Grandma during a memorable family dinner.

Gameplay
"Who the fuck ate Grandma ?" follows the point-and-click two-dimensional adventure game formula, first established by the original Maniac Mansion.
Players direct the controllable character around the family house by clicking with the computer mouse. To interact with the game world, players choose from a set of commands arrayed on the screen and then on an object in the world.
Players have to solve some puzzles in order to progress in the story.

Story
Time has come to celebrate Grandma's 93rd birthday.
Everyone gathered for this memorable family dinner, unfortunately it seems that Grandma is going to be served for dessert !

Meet all the craziest characters of this family to unearth the truth and track down the one who ate Grandma :
- Toby, he's a little weird and clingy, obsessed by his dinosaur cards, but a good kid overall.
- Bertrand, who's been recycling the same gum for a year now
- René, who made vegan sausages his specialty
- Josiane and Gustave, who got married for troubled reasons
- Chirac the dog, Jerry the parrot and many others !


I have been making this game alone, on my free time, I hope you guys will enjoy it, don't hesitate to give me your feedback ;)

name: Who The Fuck Ate Grandma ?

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS *: Windows 7 (fully patched)
  • Processor: 2 GHz
  • Memory: 4 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD 3000 or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: Intel Core2 Duo 2.4GHz or equivalent
  • Memory: 4 MB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD 5000 or better
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

short_description: Time has come to celebrate Grandma's 93rd birthday. Everyone gathered for this memorable family dinner, unfortunately it seems that Grandma is going to be served for dessert ! Inspired by the 90s, discover a new retro point&click adventure game fully drawn in pixelart
